result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor Lamar Robinson

records.addlTxt:
Competency Hearing exhibit from August 16, 2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 791.
of Commitment for Treatment ( Incompetency), signed and filed.
and Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits, received and filed.

Defendant Victor Lamar Robinson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Victor Lamar Robinson in custody.  
Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in court for competency hearing.  Parties in receipt of examiner's report. Defendant advises the court he is competent.  
State does not challenge the examiner report.  Court qualified Dr.*to testify as an expert in the field of psychology.   
Sworn for the State:  Dr. Thoomas Deboer. Direct Examination. State's Exhibit 1 offered and admitted into Evidence.
Cross Examination.   Testimony closed.  Arguments heard. by both parties.
After review of all evidence, report and testimony of Dr. Deboer court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  
Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.
 Proposed  Order of Commitment signed and forwarded to the Judge.  
Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility -  FORTHWITH. 
Court orders case adjourned  back to Branch 19 for Competency Review Hearing. 
Review hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Order Transferring Inmate Forthwith to State Mental Health Facility.  Signed and Filed.  nk

Defendant Victor Lamar Robinson in court, by Zoom, with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Victor Lamar Robinson in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victor Lamar Robinson appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for Doctor's Report Return.  State has reviewed report and does not object to Doctor's findings.  Defense has reviewed the report with Defendant; Defendant contests the report.  Court Orders Defendant to Mendota Mental Health Institute; Defense to submit Order.  Case scheduled for Competency Hearing.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm., assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
Proposed order for In Patient Competency Evaluation, Signed.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court via zoom, defendant Victor Lamar Robinson not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court waived defendant's appearance.  Per the Dr. Report, defendant was not compliant with the evaluation.  The Court ordered defendant be sent to a DHS facility for an in person evaluation.  Court ordered defendant be transferred forthwith.  Case is adjourned in Br 45.  mn  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Victor Lamar Robinson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Victor Lamar Robinson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victor Lamar Robinson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/0a25f782-7319-dd31-4ed9-c0f452a2bc2b  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.
